title.narrative: EDUCATION AND PEACEBUILDING

description.narrative: In 2019, local schools and communities will have access to validated tools for developing and promoting school based initiatives for peacebuilding, reconciliation and resilience, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Evaluation And Research, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, girls, boys and adolescents including those from conflict affected areas access and stay in an equitable, inclusive and quality education system that contributes to a sustainable peace and reconciliation process

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: In 2019, local schools and communities will have access to validated tools for developing and promoting school based initiativesfor peacebuilding, reconciliation and resilience

description.narrative: UNICEF delivered the Ministry of National Education the Schools in Peace strategy, which had been validated for educational contexts affected by violence. This strategy’s tools and methodologies helped schools implement the national standards for citizenship competencies. In 2020, the strategy was adapted to develop the COVID-19 educational continuity plan with remote methodologies in schools and targeted education secretariats. The results of this strategy led UNICEF to support the MEN in the first phase of the consultation process to update the citizenship competencies standards, which will become a national guideline in 2021 | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
